confession.seduction_context: when angry about accusations by two persons from Reillon, executed about 10 years earlier. Parsin offered him means to avenge himself on those who wished him ill

testimony.quarrel_subject: Both getting their horses ready for ploughing when they got muddled up; Jean might have been angry since he went off saying nothing

harms_alleged.harm_description: twice seen with face injured, although he made no complaint - suspected this might have been his master's doing

timeline.subject: Genin Margeron
timeline.details: Executed as witch at Domjevin; had named Jean Godot as accomplice before execution

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for depositions to be taken

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Substitut for procureur fiscal asks for arrest, interrogation, and confrontations

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - no significant results, continued to deny all charges

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - given thumbscrews and racked; confessed to witchcraft

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves, subject to repetition of confessions

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Retracted confessions, saying he only confessed to avoid greater torture

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for renewed torture

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to renewed torture

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Second interrogation under torture - racked again, renewed previous confessions

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence; Change de Nancy approves

timeline.subject: Jean Godot
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from Blamont court

his mother Barbelline had been burned as witch

economic_context.details: Jean had acted as officer for the mayor, coming round frequently to ask for fines. There was competition over land lease - Mengin Jean Claudon wanted to take over lease of land held by Jean. Jean had received provisional division of goods with 2 brothers 3 years earlier, taking over a house which was subject to duke. Had never had children to help with labor. The trial reveals economic tensions around land access, officer duties, and property boundaries (animals in meadow, hay cutting disputes).

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with 29 witnesses (2 pages missing covering witnesses 4-5). Strong pattern of reputation-based testimony stemming from multiple prior executions, particularly Jean's mother Barbelline. Economic tensions around land, officer duties, and animal losses are prominent. Jean showed unusual behavior during torture (exposing himself, discussing masturbation) and predicted his own retraction before arrest. Confessed under torture, retracted, then renewed confession under renewed torture. Notable that his sister-in-law (witness 19) testified he had long reputation but she had no suspicion he harmed them despite losing many animals. Trial follows standard Lorraine pattern: informations preparatoires, confrontations (unsuccessful), torture approved by Change de Nancy, confession, retraction, renewed torture, renewed confession, death sentence.
